title: Confusing `owned_box` error message since nightly-2019-09-04

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-help-wanted
labels.description: Call for participation: Help is requested to fix this issue.

body:
Test Program:

```rust
// lib.rs

#![no_std]

pub fn foo() {
    pub struct Writer;
    write!(Writer, "");
}
```

Error message on nightly [_9af17757b 2019-09-02_] and before:

```
error[E0599]: no method named `write_fmt` found for type `foo::Writer` in the current scope
 --> src/lib.rs:5:5
  |
4 |     pub struct Writer;
  |     ------------------ method `write_fmt` not found for this
5 |     write!(Writer, "");
  |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
  |
  = help: items from traits can only be used if the trait is implemented and in scope
  = note: the following trait defines an item `write_fmt`, perhaps you need to implement it:
          candidate #1: `core::fmt::Write`
  = note: this error originates in a macro outside of the current crate (in Nightly builds, run with -Z external-macro-backtrace for more info)
```

Error message since nightly [_b9de4ef89 2019-09-03_]:

```
error: requires `owned_box` lang_item

error: aborting due to previous error
```

**Diff Between the Nightlies:** https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/compare/9af17757be1cc3f672928ecf06c40a662c5ec26d...b9de4ef89e0e53099a084001b26ec3207c5f8391


---

Reported by @wgfm and @ambye85 in https://github.com/phil-opp/blog_os/issues/405#issuecomment-530537024.
